^Don't do this, too much Gravity.

I'd love to see this. Care to use any of my ships?

http://imgur.com/a/NQQ0H

But of course! I'll use anyone's ships, i have a plotline for them too
How to get involved? Can someone send me PM about how it works?

Have fun.

Feel free to use some MU ships and hardware in your vids, Zekes! I'm always glad to help out on this type of project.

Feel free to use some MU ships and hardware in your vids, Zekes! I'm always glad to help out on this type of project.

awesome thanks guys... I'm not sure how many of your ships I'll be able to fit in but I'll try.
You've gotten better with kerbcam(If it was used at all)

You've gotten better with kerbcam(If it was used at all)

ha, no, that's all stock mouse-movement.... but thanks I actually have no idea how to use Kerbcam.
Everyone, Trafalgar Co. has just placed an order for a few 150-200 tons ships, they will be the "Duke of Wellington" class, and will be the embodiment of power on the battlefield.

Everyone, Trafalgar Co. has just placed an order for a few 150-200 tons ships, they will be the "Duke of Wellington" class, and will be the embodiment of power on the battlefield.

200? And I thought I was going heavy when i went past 100 in the Drek.... I guess everyone's going bigger and heavier. MY Dreks are starting to get out-armored
I got the idea after surfing wikipedia and finding the HMS Duke of Wellington of 1852 which was a steam and sail warship carrying 131 guns and being twice the size of Nelson's Victory.

I got the idea after surfing wikipedia and finding the HMS Duke of Wellington of 1852 which was a steam and sail warship carrying 131 guns and being twice the size of Nelson's Victory.

oh wow That's gonna be epic.... And I can't believe I still don't have a 200 tonne ship.... I should up-weigh the 14-12, and give it more range and firepower.
200 tons is usually my upper limit, any more than that and the ship's practicality plummets as it gets heavier.

200 tons is usually my upper limit, any more than that and the ship's practicality plummets as it gets heavier.

Yeah, and part count goes wild
Yep, the Mk-II Temeraire weighed 220ish tons which meant she had horrible Delta/V for a capital ship, this immense weight was one of the reasons it was withdrawn from service so quickly.

I have a new navy battleship! Still in testing, probably got to upgrade the armor. I'm really proud of it, but it probably isn't the most practical. Mostly experimentation for me, since I don't have much practice with ships.

Armed with 3 cruise missiles and 3 turrets with four small missiles each.

Next to Zekes' Queen Elizabeth Battleship. It's a bit smaller. Weight of 113 tons.

All three turrets can rotate!

I have a new navy battleship! Still in testing, probably got to upgrade the armor. I'm really proud of it, but it probably isn't the most practical. Mostly experimentation for me, since I don't have much practice with ships.

http://i.imgur.com/Ug0Bjin.png

Armed with 3 cruise missiles and 3 turrets with four small missiles each.

Next to Zekes' Queen Elizabeth Battleship. It's a bit smaller. Weight of 113 tons.

http://i.imgur.com/43t3wZl.png

All three turrets can rotate!

http://i.imgur.com/FRdCRo4.png

the rotating turrets are impressive; Mine rotate but fall off their mounts when fired Awesome ship tho.

I did a bit of SX-12 testing today... one test involved ramming (as a way to check overall structural integrity of the hull).

The SX-12 not only utterly obliterated the target ship, but emerged from the collision completely unscathed.

I think I might be on to something.
AvronMullican has seemingly disappeared, to my great disappointment. MUST...HAVE...TURN RESULTS!

Rather bad move, but i'm (finally) ready.
https://www.dropbox.com/s/c1p77m453mwn5gt/persistent%20%285%29.sfs?dl=0

I did a bit of SX-12 testing today... one test involved ramming (as a way to check overall structural integrity of the hull).

http://i.imgur.com/CcBL6bf.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/oU7RdHZ.jpg

The SX-12 not only utterly obliterated the target ship, but emerged from the collision completely unscathed.

I think I might be on to something.

I've been thinking about ramming for a long time, the old Mk-II and Mk-III Victory class ships could ram most ships in half and survive unscathed.

So, I just pulled the new Duke of Wellington out of the hanger...

'Needs more struts' would be an understatement.

Edited November 10, 2014 by Megalodon 720

The CFFX-1, around 600 parts empty, but with a submerged hull design, decentralized armor, 8 VLS launched SAM's, a maximum of 9 P-500 Bazalt ASCM's, and a new low profile steel deckhouse.

The hull even has a slight curvature for increased munitions flexibility.

It's extremely stable in the water.

The huge size of the ship.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

EDIT: YOUCH! The P-500 Bazalt is still capable of ripping through the armor. I've now retired the harpoon and standardized the P-500 as the fleet's standard ASCM.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited November 11, 2014 by andrew123
Whose got the persistence file. I want to give it a shot once I can launch my carrier and others.

Since my new Nikes class cruiser is now my ship of the line along with the DDG-51, our navy has decided to strike the Slava class cruiser.

The Ukrayina will be left to float...

... alone.

I've been thinking about ramming for a long time, the old Mk-II and Mk-III Victory class ships could ram most ships in half and survive unscathed.

So, I just pulled the new Duke of Wellington out of the hanger...

http://i.imgur.com/SdAWi1Q.png

'Needs more struts' would be an understatement.

it looks like a big Drekevak....
